metadata.title: CVE-2021-37979 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
heap buffer overflow in WebRTC in Google Chrome prior to 94.0.4606.81allowed a remote attacker who convinced a user to browse to a maliciouswebsite to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-37979` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 94.0.4606.81-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 94.0.4606.81-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 94.0.4606.81-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 94.0.4606.81-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 94.0.4606.81-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '94.0.4606.81-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
